meanings.definition: To convey or supply (something) through a pipeline.
meanings.sent1: The workers pipelined the oil from the refinery to the storage tanks.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to pipeline the water directly to the village for easier access.
meanings.sent3: I tried to pipeline my thoughts to my friend, but they got lost in translation.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas pipelined through her mind, flowing seamlessly from one to the next.
meanings.sent5: The information was pipelined quickly and efficiently to all team members.

meanings.definition: Arranged in a series of stages in which each stage completes part of the task.
meanings.sent1: The pipelined process ensured that each step was completed before moving on to the next.
meanings.sent2: The project was designed with a pipelined approach to maximize efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The pipelined schedule made it easier to track progress and stay on target.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like a pipelined sequence, each idea neatly following the previous one.
meanings.sent5: The production line was so well pipelined that there was no room for errors.
